function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Coronavirus settling for a longer time period on surfaces at lower temperatures and in conditions of low and high relative humidity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 lasting for several days on certain materials such as plastics, ceramics, silicone rubber, glass, and stainless steel","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Advantages of copper and copper alloys in killing the virus and as building materials for high-touch surfaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of antimicrobial materials may create a false sense of security and neglect other important preventive measures.","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trends against antimicrobial additives may lead to reduced use of effective materials that can prevent the spread of viruses on surfaces.","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of evidence on the resistance of antimicrobial materials to viral loads may lead to misconceptions about their effectiveness.","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased reliance on antimicrobial additives in building materials","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promotion of laxity in hygienic practices due to false sense of security from antimicrobial materials","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential movement of antimicrobial materials into the natural environment and sewage system","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of contagion in residential shared facilities kitchens, dining rooms, etc. due to challenges with social distancing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased pressure on electricity and water resources due to remote work and distance education","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased household electricity consumption due to extended time spent at home during quarantine","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption in unoccupied public buildings during lockdown","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in controlling the consumption of natural resources in epidemic-resilient homes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in household energy consumption due to extended periods of time spent at home during quarantine","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of energy independence during complete lockdown","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inefficient energy consumption in unoccupied buildings during lockdown","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper disposal and treatment of wastewater from people infected with covid-19 affecting water, soil, environment, and living organisms","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of coronavirus genetic material in wastewater with increasing prevalence of covid-19 infection","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fecal-oral transmission of infectious diseases through wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fecal-oral transmission from improper waste disposal practices","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emergence of new solid waste from the pandemic, including contaminated medical waste and increased household waste","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing consumption of fresh water in residential buildings during quarantine","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper treatment of sewage contaminated with the virus leading to contamination of fresh water sources","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of chlorine in drinking water during distribution as an additional precaution","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emergence of new viral infectious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of diseases from animal species to humans","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of infectious diseases via indoor air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate housing conditions for low-and middle-income people","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socio-economic gap in housing levels","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor distribution of housing units","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of sustainable architectural and urban design","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate housing environment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Economic gap and housing costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing conditions contributing to the spread of contagious diseases, including covid-19, due to lack of safety and healthy environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adequate quarantine facilities and isolation spaces within housing environments, leading to uncontrolled transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address the housing needs of marginalized groups, leading to increased vulnerability to contagious diseases and public health disparities.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in population density due to movement toward urban areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Barriers restricting movement of labor and population due to long-term relief measures","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unintended inefficiencies in the housing sector due to long-term relief measures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Housing insecurity leading to mental health issues such as chronic mental disorders, depression, psychological distress, anxiety, and suicide.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in demand for larger homes and outdoor spaces may lead to overcrowding and reduced physical distancing, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decline in demand for affordable housing may lead to displacement and overcrowding in lower-income communities, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on housing prices","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Regional differences in housing preferences","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on real estate markets","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher infection rates linked to lower housing conditions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on housing market prices","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in home size and extra bedrooms in densely populated areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to social aspects in residential building assessment tools","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
